author: Paul Hannon
title: Five Takeaways From the Bank of England’s Policy Announcement
text:
A stronger global economic outlook has led some investors to expect a more aggressive tightening of central banks’ monetary policy than they had previously pencilled in for 2018, one factor driving recent volatility in financial markets. The Bank of England may have helped validate those views Thursday, using its first policy meeting in 2018 to warn that its key interest rate is likely to rise sooner and further than it had previously expected. Here are five takeaways from the central bank’s “Super Thursday”:
Further, Faster
